overview_of_class: This course charts the dynamics of urbanization in the United States, paying close attention to the major political and social issues that have accompanied that process. We survey developments dating from the period of the earliest mercantile cities to today's fragmented metropolitan areas to see how structural and demographic shifts have generated a series of public policy challenges for Americans and how political power has been marshaled and organized to address them.
name: Urban Politics
title: WCAS POLI_SCI 221-0-20 Urban Politics

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course charts the dynamics of urbanization in the United States, paying close attention to the major political and social issues that have accompanied that process. We survey developments dating from the period of the earliest mercantile cities to today's fragmented metropolitan areas to see how structural and demographic shifts have generated a series of public policy challenges for Americans and how political power has been marshaled and organized to address them.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: By the end of the course, students should have an appreciation for the structural as well as demographic complexities of American metropolitan life and how politics operates in our cities and suburbs.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Lecture, discussion sections, and some discussion during lecture
